attributes.action: Ban the manufacture of prescription medicines in varying designs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is very dangerous for old people to have to identify tablets whose physical form changes from week to week.  There should be a fixed design for each generic type of tablet and all manufacturers should be forced to follow the standard or not supply the NHS.

At present a particular drug may be orange and oval in blister packs containing 7 tablets one week and next week they are white, round and in packs of 28 and then in another format a week later.

Elderly people are so prone to confusion that this could be resulting in hundreds of deaths per year due to incorrect tablets being taken accidently.

Manufacturers have a high responsibility to patients, but they are letting us down and need to be curbed.
